title: There's more RNG to be found when laning against Tryndamere than when going to a casino.
body:
Seriously, this champion needs a rework or something to remove his toxic, anti-fun and rng based play style. I'm not necessarily saying Tryndamere is broken, but he's just one of those champions that most players universally agree that they hate playing against. Laning phase is all about attempting to capitalize on the fact Tryndamere doesnt have ultimate before 6 while simultaneously keeping a track of his Fury, max Fury = stay the hell away.

Seriously, does Riot consider this champion fun to play against? Because there is absolutely nothing fun about taking multiple Conqueror empowered critical hits before level 3 at which point you auto lose lane. Tryndamere single handedly decides if a lane is won or lost simply by how many crits he can land on you. 

Tryndameres ultimate isn't even the biggest problem I have with him, in fact I consider it one of the most unique abilities in the game. The problem I have with Tryndamere is just how fucking random it is playing against him. One second you're winning a trade but the next second he lands a critical hit and you have the decision to either stay in lane to stay even in xp and cs or back and then begin falling behind (at which point it becomes even more infuriating playing against Tryndamere).

I've always liked the idea of giving it like a base duration of 1-2s and extending it by 0.5s every time he autos or even every time he crits, with a maximum duration of like 5-10s (I don't know what would be fair). That way, if you burst him and he uses it to run it's weaker but if he's aggressive in combat and successfully sticks to his opponent, he gets rewarded.

I really like this idea because it supports the thematic of tryndamere. He dives in and wants to continue fighting for a long time. I don't think that he's supposed to be an escape artist by twirling over walls and being invulnerable.

It feels shit to play against this champ. Even though I generally don't have a problem with him, it's frustrating when I go in for a good trade, only to get RNG critted in 2 AAs and have to back off. I had cases where he managed to crit me 3 times in a row and killed me. I could technically disengage, but after getting hit with 2 crits, I didn't believe I would get RNGed and get critted again and die. Fight was a close call and if he critted once and not three times, I would have killed him first. This RNG is so bad.

With Tryns ult my gripe is how he can activate it despite being CC'd, I might be wrong here but I'm fairly sure he is the only champ in the game who can use his ult while under the effects of CC, so you essentially have an ult which you realistically can't prevent from activating unless you have a silence which so few of the roster has.

Imagine if other champions ults could do that like Annies or Lissandras.

I'll always call BS on the fact that Tryndamere can use his ultimate while stunned, silenced, or in high-orbit after an Ali pulverize because it breaks every rule about spellcasting in League of Legends.

Tryndamere, Pantheon, Mundo, Volibear, Mordekaiser and Udyr are characters that cannot get into the rework lineup fast enough.

As Tryndamere is currently designed, he _has_ to be able to cast ult through CC. If he wasn't, he would pretty much unequivocally be the worst champ in the game.

It's not as if there aren't multiple ways of dealing with trynd as he is. The fact that the meta build is essence reaver of all things pretty much says it all about the champion's susceptibility to getting kited.

The thing about reworking him is that Critical strikes are his identity, and they are always random. 

Unless they aim for a 3-hit passive = Critical strike sort of like Xin Zhao's current passive or have him perma Crit like Ashe under some condition, there is no real place to begin reworking him in a unique way that maintains his identity of Crit smacking barbarian.
